text: Nitric oxide subserves diverse physiologic roles in the nervous system .

NO is produced from at least three different NO synthase ( NOS ) isoforms : <extra_id_0> neuronal NOS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> nNOS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , <extra_id_0> endothelial NOS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> immunologic NOS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> iNOS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .
We show that <extra_id_0> nNOS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is the predominant isoform constitutively expressed in glia .

NO derived from <extra_id_0> nNOS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in glia inhibits the transcription factor nuclear factor kappaB ( NF kappaB ) as NOS inhibitors enhance basal NF kappaB activation .

Pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate ( PDTC ) is an inhibitor of NF kappaB in most cells ; however , we show that PDTC is also a potent scavenger of NO through formation of mononitrosyl iron complexes with PDTC .

In Jurkat cells , a human T-cell lymphoma cell line , <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) induces NF kappaB activation that is inhibited by PDTC .

Contrary to the results in Jurkat cells , PDTC did not inhibit <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced NF kappaB activation in astrocytes ; instead PDTC itself induces NF kappaB activation in astrocytes , and this may be related to scavenging of endogenously produced NO by the PDTC iron complex .

In astrocytes PDTC also dramatically induces the NF kappaB - dependent enzyme , <extra_id_0> iNOS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , supporting the physiologic relevance of endogenous NO regulation of NF kappaB .

text: NF kappaB activation in glia from mice lacking <extra_id_0> nNOS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> responds more rapidly to PDTC compared with astrocytes from wild-type mice .

Our data suggest that <extra_id_0> nNOS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in astrocytes regulates NF kappaB activity and <extra_id_0> iNOS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression , and indicate a novel regulatory role for <extra_id_0> nNOS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in tonically suppressing central nervous system , NF kappaB - regulated genes .
